Issues.Title: test(ivy): more precise TestBed failure causes for View/Content Queries (FW-670)
Issues.Body:
This PR is a result of the `Internal Error: The name q is already defined in scope` error message investigation in Queries tests in TestBed. It turned out that the error message is legitimate, i.e. for the particular test case that was triggering this problem the "q" local ref was defined twice: ```
``` while this was allowed and didn't trigger an error in View Engine, in Ivy the definition of local refs in a scope is more strict and refs with the same name are not allowed. This limitation is describe in breaking changes doc and corresponding test cases were added (to `ngtsc_spec.ts`) to verify the behavior. ## PR Type What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables) - [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes) - [ ] Build related changes ## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? - [ ] Yes - [x] No This PR identifies/describes a breaking change, but an actual change was introduced previously.

<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

The cli-hello-world-ivy test would only build, not actually run. With some Ivy fixes the tests can now actually be enabled:

**Fixes:**
- Pipes would not be available to JIT compiled modules.
- `@angular/compiler` was not present due to eager compilation of `@NgModule`
- Several `__POST_R3__` symbols were DCE'd. The integration test now finally catches those.

This builds on top of #27159 as the ESM5 bundle is used for tests.

## What is the new behavior?

Ivy Hello World integration test actually runs :tada:

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): return new ViewRef when detaching view
Issues.Body:
When detaching a view by its index via `ViewContainerRef.detach(index)`, in `ViewEngine` we used to return a new `ViewRef` ([for reference](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/view/refs.ts#L227)), however in Ivy we return the same `ViewRef` which means that its internal `_viewContainerRef` is never reset and we'll throw an error if the consumer tried to attach it to the `ApplicationRef`. These changes return a new `ViewRef` in order to match the original behavior.

These changes also add the same errors as `ViewEngine` when attempting to attach a view that is attached already. This was the original goal of this PR, however it ended up uncovering the issues with the `ViewRef`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): return new ViewRef when detaching view" (#27437)

Issues.Title: __Zone_disable_requestAnimationFrame and other overrides are applied too late
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/angular-cli ### Is this a regression? Not sure ### Description The polyfill file that comes with angular-cli has a section containing overrides for ZoneJS: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/64d15246494e92d0f27a100eac1b3450d1201d6b/packages/schematics/angular/application/files/src/polyfills.ts#L62 I noticed when setting `__Zone_disable_requestAnimationFrame` in a project that it wasn't actually stopping ZoneJS from patching it. When I added some logging in, it was apparent that Zone.JS was running and patching DOM APIs *before* that value wasa being set. I believe this is because Zone.JS is brought in using the `import` statement which gets hoisted to the top of the file so the ZoneJS code is running before that flag is applied ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I have created a repo demonistrating this [here](https://github.com/drummerboof/angular-raf-issue). This is literally the CLI cloned and then setting that variable. Interestingly, the issue is not reproducible on Stackblitz. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.0.7
Node: 8.9.4
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.0.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Issues.Title: Investigate init phase time Bazel unit tests
Issues.Body:
Aside from execution proper, there is always ~1.6s spent in the initialization phase. 

This seems somehow related to rules_typescript and rules_go and should be investigated further.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Investigate init phase time Bazel unit tests" (#27427)

Issues.Title: Reduce Typescript compilation running time in Bazel unit tests
Issues.Body: Typescript compilation is not always part of the critical path. When it is, it ranges from ~50ms to 5s. It is likely overshadowed by Angular Template compilation when present. Improving the performance of TseTse can help here, since in Bazel on Angular performance it was shown that TseTse takes around half the total time of even small compilations, and scales poorly
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reduce Typescript compilation running time in Bazel unit tests" (#27426)

Issues.Title: Reduce jasmine_unit_test process load time in Bazel unit tests
Issues.Body: Running the tests themselves takes between 3.4s for a single focused test to 5.5s for all tests. The amount of tests does not seem to be where most of the time is spent. Keeping the node process running as a worker can conceivable reduce the time taken for a single test to a few milliseconds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reduce jasmine_unit_test process load time in Bazel unit tests" (#27425)

Issues.Title: Reduce Angular Template compilation time in Bazel unit tests
Issues.Body:
Angular Template compilation is where most time is being spent, always running over core/common/platform-browser/http/platform-server when changing the ivy runtime. Most of these only take <100ms, but core takes 11s. 

It is not clear to me if this compilation is necessary, and can perhaps be wholly eliminated from the dependency graph. Otherwise it would need to be massively improved to ever reach the expectations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reduce Angular Template compilation time in Bazel unit tests" (#27424)

Issues.Title: AIO: show note near deprecated CLI options
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

At the moment when CLI command options are deprecated no indication is shown in AIO.

For instance in https://next.angular.io/cli/build certain options are deprecated. One of them being: `evalSourceMap`. 

The data is already provided in the JSON help https://github.com/angular/cli-builds/blob/master/help/build.json#L138

## Expectation
We should indicate that this is deprecated, and if there is a depreciation message instead of a `boolean`, we should show the message maybe.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AIO: show note near deprecated CLI options" (#27423)

Issues.Title: Enable fine grain optimization settings
Issues.Body:
While doing the sourceMaps and optimisations flags, there were several places that had duplicate logic, and options were not really type safety as in most cases a castings was used.

This tried to improve how we normalize options and also improves type safety or at least it unifies the logic into a common method.

We can now enabled/disabled optimisations for scripts and styles.

Ex: 
```
 optimization: {
   scripts: true,
   styles: false,
 },
```

Following a suggestion from @filipesilva, I combined these 2 PRs togather.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable fine grain optimization settings" (#13120)

### Repro steps

- `ng new css-test`
- `p {color: white}' > src/app/app.component.css`
- `ng build --prod --noAot --noBuildOptimizer`


### The log given by the failure
At the moment, when AOT is disabled components styles are not being optimised. Ie, cleancss is not running.

So for instance the above code, it should have been minified to `p {color: #fff}`. But this is only happening when using the AOT compiler.

### Desired functionality
Component styles should be minified both when using the JIT and AOT Compiler.

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): set `optimization` and `sourceMap` in universal production config
Issues.Body:
- When using Universal sourceMaps should not be enabled or at least `styles` sourceMaps should be disabled as these will otherwise be inlined and will be set as apart of the server side rendered page.

- While there is no benefit to optimize the scripts at server level, styles should always be minified so that the server side rendered page is smaller.

Fixes #12541 and Fixes #12940

Depends on https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/13116
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): set `optimization` and `sourceMap` in universal production config" (#13117)

Michael

$node --version
v8.13.0

6.4.1

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|

Angular: 7.0.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.10.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.10.3
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.10.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.10.3
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.10.3
@angular-devkit/core               7.0.3
@angular-devkit/schematics         7.0.3
@angular/cli                       7.0.3
@ngtools/json-schema               1.1.0
@ngtools/webpack                   7.0.3
@schematics/angular                7.0.3
@schematics/update                 0.10.3
ng-packagr                         4.4.0
rxjs                               6.3.3
typescript                         3.1.3
webpack                            4.19.1
```

### Repro steps

I'd like to extend my `tslint.json` with the defaults from Angular's schematics, using this syntax:

```json
{
  "extends": "@schematics/angular/workspace/files/tslint.json"
}
```

### The log given by the failure

`ng lint` and `tslint -p .` both fail with this error:

```
Failed to load [...]/tslint.json: Could not find custom rule directory: node_modules/codelyzer
```

The problem seems to be that relative paths in `rulesDirectory` are resolved from the location of the extended `tslint.json` inside `node_modules/`, rather than the `tslint.json` in my project's root.

### Desired functionality

The `tslint.json` template in `@schematics/angular` should just use module resolution (`"rulesDirectory": ["codelyzer"]`), this seems to work here without any issues.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[schematics/angular] Use module resolution for codelyzer in tslint.json" (#13100)

Issues.Title: addSymbolToNgModule fails when a token provider is present in the providers array of the NgModule
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/508d4df48231d4db11b690c55d51a57094a9e3ff/packages/schematics/angular/utility/ast-utils.ts#L446

The code block is same as the section where NgModule Decorator metadata does not have the provided metaDataField, however this needs to be changed as in this particular case, the last element in the providers array is an ObjectLiteral and we have to append the Symbol inside ObjectLiteral's parent (ArrayLiteral) rather than the ObjectLiteral itself.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "addSymbolToNgModule fails when a token provider is present in the providers array of the NgModule" (#13103)

Issues.Body:
Initially reported in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/26674#issuecomment-443263655 by @sod

hm indeed, just updating ngtools gives me the slowdown. Also using angular 7.1 with old ngtools 7.0.7 is significantly faster.

versions | 1st run | 2nd run | 3rd run | 4th run | 5th run
-|--|--|--|--|-
`@angular 7.0.4, @ngtools 7.0.7` | 31s | 15s | 7s | 5s | 5s
`@angular 7.0.4, @ngtools 7.1.0` | 29s | 14.5s | 15.5s | 12s | 12s
`@angular 7.1.1, @ngtools 7.1.0` | 29s | 13.5s | 13.5s | 15s | 16s
`@angular 7.1.1, @ngtools 7.0.7` | 28s | 12.8s | 7s | 5s | 4.2s

Issues.Title: Angular Material Getting Started should mention ng add as primary installation option
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Today I went with a beginner in Angular over adding Material Design and she started running the installation manually as she read in the [getting started](https://material.angular.io/guide/getting-started) guide. I think it makes most sense to have the first step in Getting Started being the `ng add` option. #### What is the expected behavior? Developers should be advised to use `ng add @angular/material`. #### What is the current behavior? Developers are currently advised to manually install the dependencies, then the snapshots, and after that the `ng add` option. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? It should be as easy as possible for people starting with Angular to add Angular Material. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know? I would love to make the changes to the docs if the maintainers agree it should be addressed. Basically creating this issue to spark a conversation around it, if you agree I'll submit a PR üëç
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material Getting Started should mention ng add as primary installation option" (#14380)

Issues.Title: Add (invisible) close button to datepicker overlay
Issues.Body: The datepicker presents itself as a modal dialog. On mobile devices, scree-reader users don't have an escape button to press and obviously would have a hard time tapping on the backdrop. We can add a close button with `cdk-visually-hidden` to help work around this. The label for this would also have to be added to `MatDatepickerIntl`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add (invisible) close button to datepicker overlay" (#14379)

Issues.Title: Rename MatTableDataSource to ClientArrayTableDataSource
Issues.Body:
I see too frequently people misunderstand the intent behind `MatTableDataSource`, thinking that it's meant to be the primary (or only) way to add data to the table. Renaming this, and more eminently presenting it in the docs as just one option would hopefully help clear this up. 

Obviously this will need to be done in a backwards compatible way. It will also need a migration schematic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Rename MatTableDataSource to ClientArrayTableDataSource" (#14378)

Issues.Title: MatDialog scroll entire dialog
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: feature request #### What is the expected behavior? An ability to scroll the entire dialog and not just the content. Meaning - the dialog should have the full height of its content and scrolling will happen "outside" the dialog. The dialog would expand beyond the boundaries of the view. #### What is the current behavior? Scrolling can only happen inside the dialog. This creates a confusing UX where users don't have an indication that there is more content under scroll. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatDialog scroll entire dialog" (#14377)

Issues.Title: table[mat-table] doesn't allow debugElement.query to find directives inside it
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug: `table[mat-table]` makes testing hard because it doesn't have a way for getting `debugElement`s to be queried.

#### What is the expected behavior?
`fixture.debugElement.query(By.css('*'))` should find directives inside a mat-table

#### What is the current behavior?
`fixture.debugElement.query(By.css('*'))` only finds `table[mat-table]` as a DebugElement but it can't find any other debug element that's a child of the table

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-testing-template-4n6yno
This has 2 describes: 1 with `table[mat-table]` (normal table) and another with `mat-table` (flex tables)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Testing is hard otherwise, my work around has been overriding the module, remove the directive, make a fake directive that has `@HostBinding('click') click() { capturedInstance = this; }` and test with that.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
6.0.0

#### Is there anything else we should know?
As implicitly mentioned above, `<mat-table>` works OK, the problem seems to be on how `<table mat-table>` renders the rows which seems to be with `createEmbeddedView`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "table[mat-table] doesn't allow debugElement.query to find directives inside it" (#14375)

Issues.Title: Add ability to lazy render content for specific panel in case of nested expansion panels
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
Only expansion panel that contains template with `matExpansionPanelContent` directive should lazy render it in case of a nested expansion panels.

#### What is the current behavior?
All parent expansion panels render `matExpansionPanelContent` template of child panel if they don't contain any specific template for themself.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
StackBlitz reproduction: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-fa7h1c


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
There is a case where I have to use nested expansion panels with lazy rendering for different content blocks in the child expansion panels. If I want to render content properly, then I also have to make all parent expansion panels content lazy rendered.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 6.1.1
Material 6.4.2
TypeScript 2.9.2

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This issue can be also reproduced on the latest versions of Angular and Material
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add ability to lazy render content for specific panel in case of nested expansion panels" (#14365)

Issues.Title: chore: improve type safety in breakpoint observer
Issues.Body:
Fixes a workaround where we cast the MediaQueryList event listener to any because TypeScript didn't have proper types before TS 3.1. 

There is still asignature issue with our current TypeScript version, but at least we can now type all other declarations, and just have a wrong signature for `removeListener`. This has been fixed with https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/commit/40bd7c89abbdf79493e2ea20dd80d9eb657dc82e and can be used with v3.2.1 (once we upgrade in the future)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "chore: improve type safety in breakpoint observer" (#14356)

Issues.Title: MatSnackBar to show in a specified container
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
SnackBar should be shown in a specified container / viewContainerRef

#### What is the current behavior?
SnackBar is always shown in the bottom of page. That can cause accessibility violations like covering a navigation bottom bar.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Stackblitz 1: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hoeafv
Stackblitz 2 (as provided in #11038): https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-1jgbvq

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Currently a SnackBar popping up would cover a bottom navigation bar. Being able to specify the container / viewContainerRef would allow to specify the main container, thus avoiding the bottom navigation bar.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Misleading info in https://material.angular.io/components/snack-bar/api#MatSnackBarConfig
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatSnackBar to show in a specified container" (#14351)
